page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO FORTHAMPTON
page.content: The Forthampton area is a truly agricultural part of the West Midlands. The area is one of gently undulating land rising from the flood plain of the west bank of the River Severn to a maximum height of 175'. Farming is the only real source of employment today, and the landscape reflects a picture little changed since the original clearing of the woodland hundreds of years ago. There is one main road, the A438, from Tewkesbury to Ledbury, along which lies the hamlet of Long Green. In the centre of the area is the village of Forthampton. Forthampton village is dominated by the Yorkes of Forthampton Court, the manor house which lies at the extreme east of the village. Life in this block hinges on the Court and farming.
